availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eldred Earl Pate (Hancock County, Kentucky, circuit and county court clerk)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, court clerk. Hancock County, Kentucky, native. Son of Minor E. Pate and Rebecca Pate. Married Sallie B. Martin Pate on September 1, 1863 in Hancock County. Attended Greenville College. Clerk of the Hancock County Court in Hancock County from 1862 to 1866. Clerk of the Hancock Circuit Court in Hancock County from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 300A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 926.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 179B.
“A Popular Minister,” Hartford Herald (KY), October 5, 1892.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hancock County, KY, 1863, p. 26.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729, p. 348.
